remarks: A vector which doesn't belong to a subspace is nonzero.  (Contributed by NM, 14-May-2015.)
statement:
lssneln0.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lssneln0.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
lssneln0.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lssneln0.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LMod ) $.
lssneln0.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. S ) $.
lssneln0.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lssneln0.n $e |- ( ph -> -. X e. U ) $.
lssneln0 $p |- ( ph -> X e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
